verses.verse: Therefore<WG1352> leaving<WG863> the elementary<WG746> teaching<WG3056> about the Christ,<WG5547> let us press<WG5342> on to maturity,<WG5047> not laying<WG2598> again<WG3825> a foundation<WG2310> of repentance<WG3341> from dead<WG3498> works<WG2041> and of faith<WG4102> toward<WG1909> God,<WG2316>
of instruction<WG1322> about washings,<WG909> and laying<WG1936> on of hands,<WG5495> and the resurrection<WG386> of the dead,<WG3498> and eternal<WG166> judgment.<WG2917>
And this<WG3778> we shall do,<WG4160> if<WG1437> <WG4007> God<WG2316> permits.<WG2010>

For in the case of those<WG3588> who have once<WG530> been enlightened<WG5461> and have tasted<WG1089> of the heavenly<WG2032> gift<WG1431> and have been<WG1096> made<WG1096> partakers<WG3353> of the Holy<WG40> Spirit,<WG4151>
and have tasted<WG1089> the good<WG2570> word<WG4487> of God<WG2316> and the powers<WG1411> of the age<WG165> to come,<WG3195>

and [then] have fallen<WG3895> away,<WG3895> it is impossible<WG102> to renew<WG340> them again<WG3825> to repentance,<WG3341> since they again<WG388> crucify<WG388> to themselves<WG1438> the Son<WG5207> of God,<WG2316> and put<WG3856> Him to open<WG3856> shame.<WG3856>

For ground<WG1093> that drinks<WG4095> the rain<WG5205> which often<WG4178> falls<WG2064> upon it and brings<WG5088> forth<WG5088> vegetation<WG1008> useful<WG2111> to those<WG1565> for whose<WG3739> sake<WG1223> it is also<WG2532> tilled,<WG1090> receives<WG3335> a blessing<WG2129> from God;<WG2316>
but if it yields<WG1627> thorns<WG173> and thistles,<WG5146> it is worthless<WG96> and close<WG1451> to being cursed,<WG2671> and it ends<WG5056> up being burned.<WG2740>

But, beloved,<WG27> we are convinced<WG3982> of better<WG2909> things<WG2909> concerning<WG4012> you, and things that accompany<WG2192> salvation,<WG4991> though<WG1487> <WG2532> we are speaking<WG2980> in this<WG3779> way.<WG3779>

For God<WG2316> is not unjust<WG94> so as to forget<WG1950> your work<WG2041> and the love<WG26> which<WG3739> you have shown<WG1731> toward<WG1519> His name,<WG3686> in having ministered<WG1247> and in still ministering<WG1247> to the saints.<WG40>

And we desire<WG1937> that each<WG1538> one<WG1538> of you show<WG1731> the same<WG846> diligence<WG4710> so<WG4314> as to realize the full<WG4136> assurance<WG4136> of hope<WG1680> until<WG891> the end,<WG5056>
that you may not be sluggish,<WG3576> but imitators<WG3402> of those<WG3588> who through<WG1223> faith<WG4102> and patience<WG3115> inherit<WG2816> the promises.<WG1860>
For when God<WG2316> made<WG1861> the promise<WG1861> to Abraham,<WG11> since<WG1893> He could<WG2192> swear<WG3660> by no<WG3762> one<WG3762> greater,<WG3173> He swore<WG3660> by Himself,<WG1438>
saying,<WG3004> "I will surely<WG3375> <WG2127> bless<WG2127> you, and I will surely<WG4129> multiply<WG4129> you."
And thus,<WG3779> having patiently<WG3114> waited,<WG3114> he obtained<WG2013> the promise.<WG1860>
For men<WG444> swear<WG3660> by one<WG3173> greater<WG3173> [than themselves], and with them an oath<WG3727> [given] as confirmation<WG951> is an end<WG4009> of every<WG3956> dispute.<WG485>

In the same<WG3739> way God,<WG2316> desiring<WG1014> even<WG4053> more<WG4053> to show<WG1925> to the heirs<WG2818> of the promise<WG1860> the unchangeableness<WG276> of His purpose,<WG1012> interposed<WG3315> with an oath,<WG3727>

in order<WG2443> that by two<WG1417> unchangeable<WG276> things,<WG4229> in which<WG3739> it is impossible<WG102> for God<WG2316> to lie,<WG5574> we may have<WG2192> strong<WG2478> encouragement,<WG3874> we who have fled<WG2703> for refuge<WG2703> in laying<WG2902> hold<WG2902> of the hope<WG1680> set<WG4295> before<WG4295> us.
This<WG3739> hope we have<WG2192> as an anchor<WG45> of the soul,<WG5590> a [hope] both<WG5037> sure<WG804> and steadfast<WG949> and one which enters<WG1525> within<WG2082> the veil,<WG2665>

where<WG3699> Jesus<WG2424> has entered<WG1525> as a forerunner<WG4274> for us, having become<WG1096> a high<WG749> priest<WG749> forever<WG165> according<WG2596> to the order<WG5010> of Melchizedek.<WG3198>
